title.value: Implicitly Bayesian Prediction Rules in Deep Learning
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning of the paper and aligns with the content discussed regarding Bayesian principles in deep learning.
title.quote: Implicitly Bayesian Prediction Rules in Deep Learning

extractions.description: The paper explores the concept of integrating Bayesian principles into deep learning by rethinking traditional methods. It introduces the notion of 'implicitly Bayesian' prediction rules, which are characterized as Bayesian without explicitly using priors and posteriors. The paper proposes a measure to evaluate how closely a prediction strategy aligns with being implicitly Bayesian and evaluates several prediction strategies using this approach. Theoretical arguments are provided, demonstrating that non-implicitly Bayesian agents can be exploited in adversarial settings.

type.justification: The paper includes experiments and empirical evaluations of prediction strategies to demonstrate the proposed measure of being implicitly Bayesian.
type.quote: We empirically demonstrate our proposed measure by investigating how various design decisions affect how close an algorithm is to being implicitly Bayesian on a small regression task (Section 4.2).
